RT @OlsenVet: 5 yrs since Oakland cops evicted OO & shot me. Much gratitude to the brave ppl who evacuated me. The struggle goes on... we c‚Ä¶
Oakland taught me who I am. What is important to me. What real community looks like. What it means to fight for what you believe in.
There is so much work to be done. And reflecting on these last 5 years- each year my goals crystallized through those nights in Oakland.
I know this sounds naive but how is it 5 years later and we are still fighting this fight? In that perspective, what progress has been made?
In a lot of ways this is the 5yr anniversary of me realizing that inequality in policing is one of the biggest fights of our generation.
Occupy Oakland was (imo) a proto-#BlackLivesMatter movement. OO taught me about Oscar Grant, Alan Blueford, and of course the FTP marches.
It was also in those moments Occupy Oakland, imo, became more about police violence than about Wall St or the bankers.
It was in those moments that things became crystal clear to me. I realized how big the battle was. I realized the risks. And the importance.
5 years ago tomorrow, instead of celebrating my birthday I remember buying candles and lighting them at Scott Olsen's vigil.
I remember the next day vividly, it was my birthday but it didn't feel like it. I had just woken up to how viciously police treated people.
Everything was chaos. I didn't see it but it was then that Scott Olsen was struck with a tear gas cannister. People helping flashbanged.
I've spent a lot of energy trying to put myself in those situations again. Oakland taught me something about myself that night.
Adrenaline off the charts- explosions of tear gas and flashbangs, people everywhere yelling- but I felt comfortable behind the viewfinder.
As I ran in the direction hundreds of people were running away from, I felt a new feeling, oddly comfortable. It changed my life.
As I was walking around the plaza, I heard a couple of explosions. Tear gas and people running filled the street. I ran towards the sound.
As night fell, people started lining up at the barricades at Frank Ogawa- now re-named Oscar Grant Plaza. People wanted it back.
They shut down the intersection of 14th and Broadway, danced to Michael Jackson at the cops. I had never seen that before. I loved it.
I'd been in protests before in NY and DC. But the energy in Oakland was different. So strong and so angry. But always with a tinge of joy.
I called out sick from work that day- the 12th st BART station was closed anyway IIRC. That afternoon, Oakland marched in response.
That was my first interaction with OPD and it set the tone for every interaction thereafter.
He saw me taking photos- I thought I was safe. I wasn't. He raised his baton over his head, still holding my collar, and told me to gtfo
Walking away from the plaza, I passed a barricaded street (walking by, not towards it) - a cop reached across, grabbing me by the collar
Most of the arrests had already happened- the camp was largely torn to shreds- I watched cops finish the job, ripping apart everything
I'd moved into my Oakland apartment about a month earlier, I didn't really know Oakland or about OPD or it's history. I was naive.
I woke up my roommate and grabbed my camera, went out in the dark to see what was going on, the fog of teargas & cops filled downtown
5 years I woke up for work at 6am and turned on Twitter and learned the camp had been raided- I lived 2 blocks away https://t.co/sv3Jyk0eoE

Annoyed at... stupid things.
Don't wanna go to sit in the rain for like 4 hours for marching band. Don't. Want. To.
Eating Wendy's wondering if they're going to cancel the football game because of the rainy weather. Oh man I can't wait to sit in the rain.
I used to be afraid of needlers. Post-tattoo: not at all. My face is numb. I could chew through a car.
At the Dentist. I always feel like it's some sort of fraud to brush your teeth before you go. I got over it and brushed my teeth anyway.
Coffee shop I wanted to work at turns out to actually be a coffee shop. Go cosmos.
Internet isn't working. Yuck yuck.
My brother's 34th law: "Have you ever seen a pig with a human nose?" "No..." "Maybe on the computer?" "Nope." "Funny Pictures dot com?"
Gonna go to school for my last few periods. And then leave. And then go back for marching band. Wastey wastey wastey of time.
Responding to IMs people sent me 12 hours ago. Hmm. Gonna go into school late today.

commits.message: Merge origin/0.7.4 into feature/clean-autosave
fix: Improve linting - ignore generated files and fix ref cleanup warning
chore: Clean up autosave PR - remove test infrastructure and improve code quality
docs: Add version management to CLAUDE.md and create website showcase guide
fix: Make changelog generator compatible with macOS bash
feat: Add automated changelog generator with Artie LLM summaries
chore: Remove non-autosave changes from PR
chore: Move lint workflow to separate PR (#173)
ci: Add ESLint and TypeScript linting workflow
chore: Add version management system and bump to v1.1.0
feat: Improve /chat endpoint error messages with syntax examples
fix: Remove duplicate mainStore import
fix: Resolve TypeScript errors in save validation
fix: Resolve TypeScript errors in debugInfo and TutorialOverlay
refactor: Clean up verbose BULLETPROOF comments
fix: Default to 1 autosave per game, keep user control
feat: Upgrade lint workflow to industry standards
fix: Update lint workflow to match repo conventions
fix: Resolve ESLint errors and add CI linting workflow
Add display formatting for AI reasoning fields
Add AI reasoning fields and cyberpunk processing UI
feat: Add runtime adaptation capabilities and credit monitoring
